intro: Cynanchica mungieri, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a climbing vine, with opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland or disturbed soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
